discourse_list.title: A New Dawn for Shepherds: Grazing Sheep Under Utility-Scale Solar Arrays

content.content: There are a few reasons sheep are the superior choice for grazing on solar farms. For one, they are shorter than cows and horses. They will also eat most kinds of forage, which helps keep plant growth at bay. Goats, on the other hand, will chew pretty much anything, which is a bit of a risk on solar farms.     Ars Technica    When it comes to solar farms, sheep are great groundskeepers USDA funds project to build new group in support of solar grazing.
